intro: Discolobium paucijugum, commonly known as the narrow-leafed discolobium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Fabaceae. It is native to Australia and is characterized by its narrow, often hairy leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense spikes, which are typically borne on the stems. It is a shrub-like species that thrives in dry, well-drained soils. Discolobium paucijugum is often found in arid and semi-arid regions, contributing to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
